snippet.textDisplay: Easily my favorite soundtrack ever. Megaman X is up there but this is still untouchable. I honestly don't think any game is comparable .

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky  I think Dark Souls has equivalent experience as old school plus Metroidvania era. To think the game mostly required your skill and perception more than character's stats point like old school one. but the layout and non-linear exploring to find item and grinding sometime improve your chance to survive like Metroidvania. It's not so exaggerate to say Dark Souls is the new generation Castlevania. and the reboot Castlevania is somehow just a God of War Clone.
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky  I think Dark Souls has equivalent experience as old school plus Metroidvania era. To think the game mostly required your skill and perception more than character's stats point like old school one. but the layout and non-linear exploring to find item and grinding sometime improve your chance to survive like Metroidvania. It's not so exaggerate to say Dark Souls is the new generation Castlevania. and the reboot Castlevania is somehow just a God of War Clone.

snippet.textDisplay: @pipedreamsam I find it very easy. Only died ~20 times. Maybe because I played Demons Souls so much but I was disappointed.

snippet.textDisplay: The very first time I ever finished this was during a live internet stream. That boss rush, at the end, was a pain in the butt and, I think, took me an hour just on it's own. Hearing this song was a grand reward for all that hardship!

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Thats EXACTLY the way I feel about Dark Souls. I remember a while ago you posted the Great Grey Wolf Syf battle music and said you were gonna try it and somehow I knew you'd like it. Dark Souls reminds me of the great old Castlevania games because progressing through the game and finishing it is an achievment on its own, no need for fanfare, just you, your sword and shield against the world. Thanks SupraDarky
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky Thats EXACTLY the way I feel about Dark Souls. snippet.textDisplay: @electricmastro Yeah. The game is insanely hard and rewarding.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm thankful that I still have this game and play it to this very day.  Still one of my all time favorite games.  It is hands down the best OST on the SNES in my opinion.  It's a shame that we will never have a generation of games as great as the ones that were put out in the late 80's to early 90's...they will never be duplicated.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm thankful that I still have this game and play it to this very day.  Still one of my all time favorite games.  It is hands down the best OST on the SNES in my opinion.  It's a shame that we will never have a generation of games as great as the ones that were put out in the late 80's to early 90's...they will never be duplicated.

snippet.textDisplay: @dunder567 It's true I think the audience of today is full of youth who don't fully understand the complications of a game. Hence why we always hear five year olds who scream into there mics because of their fails. Games like Castlevaina and Dark souls show that you can make a game that teaches you more then frustrates you. I wasn't really a big fan of dark souls but I can say it did remind me of Castlevaina. In a good way.
snippet.textOriginal: @dunder567 It's true I think the audience of today is full of youth who don't fully understand the complications of a game. snippet.textDisplay: Is it safe to say that this game has a flawless soundtrack?
snippet.textOriginal: Is it safe to say that this game has a flawless soundtrack?

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky It's weird that you say that because I was just playing the original Castlevania and was thinking how similar it is to Dark Souls and Demon's Souls - especially the way both games encourage you to find effective solutions to beat the level design and learn from your mistakes. It's a shame they don't make many games that reach that level of challenge and satisfaction.
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky It's weird that you say that because I was just playing the original Castlevania and was thinking how similar it is to Dark Souls and Demon's Souls - especially the way both games encourage you to find effective solutions to beat the level design and learn from your mistakes. It's a shame they don't make many games that reach that level of challenge and satisfaction.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky People don't make games like they used to, but is Dark Souls an exception?
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky People don't make games like they used to, but is Dark Souls an exception?

snippet.textDisplay: Man. this SNES music is so GOOD
snippet.textOriginal: Man. this SNES music is so GOOD

snippet.textDisplay: I finished Dark Souls an hour ago and it might end up being one of my favorite games of all time. I absolutely loved it. In a way, Dark Souls is the modern equivalent of the experience I had with the old school Castlevania games as a kid. Dark and gloomy atmosphere, alone against what seems insurmountable odds, and an awesome feeling of accomplishment when you succeed. I find this track fits perfectly that sense of accomplishment.
snippet.textOriginal: I finished Dark Souls an hour ago and it might end up being one of my favorite games of all time. I absolutely loved it. In a way, Dark Souls is the modern equivalent of the experience I had with the old school Castlevania games as a kid. Dark and gloomy atmosphere, alone against what seems insurmountable odds, and an awesome feeling of accomplishment when you succeed. I find this track fits perfectly that sense of accomplishment.
